11.title: Launch Single-File Source-Code Programs
11.summary: Enhance the java launcher to run a program supplied as a single file of Java source code, including usage from within a script by means of "shebang" files and related techniques.

11.title: Nest-Based Access Control
11.summary: Introduce nests, an access-control context that aligns with the existing notion of nested types in the Java programming language. Nests allow classes that are logically part of the same code entity, but which are compiled to distinct class files, to access each other's private members without the need for compilers to insert accessibility-broadening bridge methods.

11.title: Improve Aarch64 Intrinsics
11.summary: Improve the existing string and array intrinsics, and implement new intrinsics for the java.lang.Math sin, cos and log functions, on AArch64 processors.

11.title: Unicode 10
11.summary: Upgrade existing platform APIs to support version 10.0 of the Unicode Standard.

11.title: Key Agreement with Curve25519 and Curve448
11.summary: Implement key agreement using Curve25519 and Curve448 as described in RFC 7748.

11.title: Deprecate the Nashorn JavaScript Engine
11.summary: Deprecate the Nashorn JavaScript script engine and APIs, and the jjs tool, with the intent to remove them in a future release.

11.title: Deprecate the Pack200 Tools and API
11.summary: Deprecate the pack200 and unpack200 tools, and the Pack200 API in java.util.jar.

11.title: ZGC: A Scalable Low-Latency Garbage Collector (Experimental)
11.summary: The Z Garbage Collector, also known as ZGC, is a scalable low-latency garbage collector.

11.title: Local-Variable Syntax for Lambda Parameters
11.summary: Allow var to be used when declaring the formal parameters of implicitly typed lambda expressions.

11.title: Remove the Java EE and CORBA Modules
11.summary: Remove the Java EE and CORBA modules from the Java SE Platform and the JDK. These modules were deprecated in Java SE 9 with the declared intent to remove them in a future release.

11.title: Low-Overhead Heap Profiling
11.summary: Provide a low-overhead way of sampling Java heap allocations, accessible via JVMTI.

11.title: HTTP Client (Standard)
11.summary: Standardize the incubated HTTP Client API introduced in JDK 9, via JEP 110, and updated in JDK 10.

11.title: Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.3
11.summary: Implement version 1.3 of the Transport Layer Security (TLS) Protocol RFC 8446.

11.title: Dynamic Class-File Constants
11.summary: Extend the Java class-file format to support a new constant-pool form, CONSTANT_Dynamic. Loading a CONSTANT_Dynamic will delegate creation to a bootstrap method, just as linking an invokedynamic call site delegates linkage to a bootstrap method.

11.title: Flight Recorder
11.summary: Provide a low-overhead data collection framework for troubleshooting Java applications and the HotSpot JVM.

11.title: Epsilon: A No-Op Garbage Collector (Experimental)
11.summary: Develop a GC that handles memory allocation but does not implement any actual memory reclamation mechanism. Once the available Java heap is exhausted, the JVM will shut down.

11.title: ChaCha20 and Poly1305 Cryptographic Algorithms
11.summary: Implement the ChaCha20 and ChaCha20-Poly1305 ciphers as specified in RFC 7539. ChaCha20 is a relatively new stream cipher that can replace the older, insecure RC4 stream cipher.

12.title: Microbenchmark Suite
12.summary: Add a basic suite of microbenchmarks to the JDK source code, and make it easy for developers to run existing microbenchmarks and create new ones.

12.title: One AArch64 Port, Not Two
12.summary: Remove all of the sources related to the arm64 port while retaining the 32-bit ARM port and the 64-bit aarch64 port.

12.title: Default CDS Archives
12.summary: Enhance the JDK build process to generate a class data-sharing (CDS) archive, using the default class list, on 64-bit platforms.

12.title: Raw String Literals (Preview)
12.summary: Add raw string literals to the Java programming language. A raw string literal can span multiple lines of source code and does not interpret escape sequences, such as \n, or Unicode escapes, of the form \uXXXX. This will be a preview language feature.

12.title: Promptly Return Unused Committed Memory from G1
12.summary: Enhance the G1 garbage collector to automatically return Java heap memory to the operating system when idle.

12.title: Switch Expressions (Preview)
12.summary: Extend the switch statement so that it can be used as either a statement or an expression, and that both forms can use either a "traditional" or "simplified" scoping and control flow behavior. These changes will simplify everyday coding, and also prepare the way for the use of pattern matching (JEP 305) in switch. This will be a preview language feature.

12.title: Abortable Mixed Collections for G1
12.summary: Make G1 mixed collections abortable if they might exceed the pause target.

12.title: JVM Constants API
12.summary: Introduce an API to model nominal descriptions of key class-file and run-time artifacts, in particular constants that are loadable from the constant pool.

12.title: Shenandoah: A Low-Pause-Time Garbage Collector (Experimental)
12.summary: Add a new garbage collection (GC) algorithm named Shenandoah which reduces GC pause times by doing evacuation work concurrently with the running Java threads. Pause times with Shenandoah are independent of heap size, meaning you will have the same consistent pause times whether your heap is 200 MB or 200 GB.

8.title: PKCS#11 Crypto Provider for 64-bit Windows
8.summary: Include the SunPKCS11 provider in the JDK for 64-bit Windows.

8.title: Mechanical Checking of Caller-Sensitive Methods
8.summary: Improve the security of the JDK's method-handle implementation by replacing the existing hand-maintained list of caller-sensitive methods with a mechanism that accurately identifies such methods and allows their callers to be discovered reliably.

8.title: Retire Some Rarely-Used GC Combinations
8.summary: Remove three rarely-used combinations of garbage collectors in order to reduce ongoing development, maintenance, and testing costs.

8.title: Nashorn JavaScript Engine
8.summary: Design and implement a new lightweight, high-performance implementation of JavaScript, and integrate it into the JDK. The new engine will be made available to Java applications via the existing javax.script API, and also more generally via a new command-line tool.

8.title: SHA-224 Message Digests
8.summary: Implement the SHA-224 message-digest algorithm and related algorithms.

8.title: Fence Intrinsics
8.summary: Add three memory-ordering intrinsics to the sun.misc.Unsafe class.

8.title: DocLint
8.summary: Provide a means to detect errors in Javadoc comments early in the development cycle and in a way that is easily linked back to the source code.

8.title: JDBC 4.2
8.summary: Minor enhancements to JDBC to improve usability and portability

8.title: Enhance javac to Improve Build Speed
8.summary: Reduce the time required to build the JDK and enable incremental builds by modifying the Java compiler to run on all available cores in a single persistent process, track package and class dependences between builds, automatically generate header files for native methods, and clean up class and header files that are no longer needed.

8.title: Autoconf-Based Build System
8.summary: Introduce autoconf (./configure-style) build setup, refactor the Makefiles to remove recursion, and leverage JEP 139: Enhance javac to Improve Build Speed.

8.title: Document JDK API Support and Stability
8.summary: There is a long-standing shortcoming in the JDK in terms of clearly specifying the support and stability usage contract for com.sun.* types and other types shipped with the JDK that are outside of the Java SE specification. These contracts and potential evolution policies should be clearly captured both in the source code of the types and in the resulting class files. This information can be modeled with JDK-specific annotation types.

8.title: Base64 Encoding & Decoding
8.summary: Define a standard API for Base64 encoding and decoding.

8.title: Enhanced Verification Errors
8.summary: Provide additional contextual information about bytecode-verification errors to ease diagnosis of bytecode or stackmap deficiencies in the field.

8.title: Optimize java.text.DecimalFormat.format
8.summary: Optimize java.text.DecimalFormat.format by taking advantage of numerical properties of integer and floating-point arithmetic to accelerate cases with two or three digits after the decimal point.

8.title: Unicode 6.2
8.summary: Extend existing platform APIs to support version 6.2 of the Unicode Standard.

8.title: Statically-Linked JNI Libraries
8.summary: Enhance the JNI specification to support statically linked native libraries.

8.title: Reduce Cache Contention on Specified Fields
8.summary: Define a way to specify that one or more fields in an object are likely to be highly contended across processor cores so that the VM can arrange for them not to share cache lines with other fields, or other objects, that are likely to be independently accessed.

8.title: HTTP URL Permissions
8.summary: Define a new type of network permission which grants access in terms of URLs rather than low-level IP addresses.

8.title: Limited doPrivileged
8.summary: Enable code to assert a subset of its privileges without otherwise preventing the full access-control stack walk to check for other permissions.

8.title: Restrict Fetching of External XML Resources
8.summary: Enhance the JAXP APIs to add the ability to restrict the set of network protocols that may be used to fetch external resources.

8.title: Handle Frequent HashMap Collisions with Balanced Trees
8.summary: Improve the performance of java.util.HashMap under high hash-collision conditions by using balanced trees rather than linked lists to store map entries. Implement the same improvement in the LinkedHashMap class.

8.title: Add Javadoc to javax.tools
8.summary: Extend the javax.tools API to provide access to javadoc.

8.title: Bulk Data Operations for Collections
8.summary: Add functionality to the Java Collections Framework for bulk operations upon data. This is commonly referenced as "filter/map/reduce for Java." The bulk data operations include both serial (on the calling thread) and parallel (using many threads) versions of the operations. Operations upon data are generally expressed as lambda functions.

8.title: Small VM
8.summary: Support the creation of a small VM that is no larger than 3MB.

8.title: Annotations on Java Types
8.summary: Extend the set of annotatable locations in the syntax of the Java programming language to include names which indicate the use of a type as well as (per Java SE 5.0) the declaration of a type.

8.title: DocTree API
8.summary: Extend the Compiler Tree API to provide structured access to the content of javadoc comments.

8.title: Reduce Core-Library Memory Usage
8.summary: Reduce the dynamic memory used by core-library classes without adversely impacting performance.

8.title: Reduce Class Metadata Footprint
8.summary: Reduce HotSpot's class metadata memory footprint in order to improve performance on small devices.

8.title: Parallel Array Sorting
8.summary: Add additional utility methods to java.util.Arrays that use the JSR 166 Fork/Join parallelism common pool to provide sorting of arrays in parallel.

8.title: Generalized Target-Type Inference
8.summary: Smoothly expand the scope of method type-inference to support (i) inference in method context and (ii) inference in chained calls.

8.title: Enhance Core Libraries with Lambda
8.summary: Enhance the Java core library APIs using the new lambda language feature to improve the usability and convenience of the library.

8.title: Launch JavaFX Applications
8.summary: Enhance the java command-line launcher to launch JavaFX applications.

8.title: Date & Time API
8.summary: Define a new date, time, and calendar API for the Java SE platform.

8.title: Remove the Annotation-Processing Tool (apt)
8.summary: Remove the apt tool, associated API, and documentation from the JDK.

8.title: Access to Parameter Names at Runtime
8.summary: Provide a mechanism to easily and reliably retrieve the parameter names of methods and constructors at runtime via core reflection.

8.title: AEAD CipherSuites
8.summary: Support the AEAD/GCM cipher suites defined by SP-800-380D, RFC 5116, RFC 5246, RFC 5288, RFC 5289 and RFC 5430.

8.title: MS-SFU Kerberos 5 Extensions
8.summary: Add the MS-SFU extensions to the JDK's Kerberos 5 implementation.

8.title: TLS Server Name Indication (SNI) Extension
8.summary: Add support for the TLS Server Name Indication (SNI) Extension to allow more flexible secure virtual hosting and virtual-machine infrastructure based on SSL/TLS protocols.

8.title: Concurrency Updates
8.summary: Scalable updatable variables, cache-oriented enhancements to the ConcurrentHashMap API, ForkJoinPool improvements, and additional Lock and Future classes.

8.title: Charset Implementation Improvements
8.summary: Improve the maintainability and performance of the standard and extended charset implementations.

8.title: javax.lang.model Implementation Backed by Core Reflection
8.summary: Provide an implementation of the javax.lang.model.* API backed by core reflection rather than by javac. In other words, provide an alternate API to access and process the reflective information about loaded classes provided by core reflection.

8.title: Leverage CPU Instructions for AES Cryptography
8.summary: Improve the out-of-box AES Crypto performance by using x86 AES instructions when available, and by avoiding unnecessary re-expansion of the AES key.

8.title: Repeating Annotations
8.summary: Change the Java programming language to allow multiple application of annotations with the same type to a single program element.

8.title: Stronger Algorithms for Password-Based Encryption
8.summary: Provide stronger Password-Based-Encryption (PBE) algorithm implementations in the SunJCE provider.

8.title: Prepare for Modularization
8.summary: Undertake changes to smooth the eventual transition to modules in a future release, provide new tools to help developers prepare for the modular platform, and deprecate certain APIs that are a significant impediment to modularization.

8.title: Lambda-Form Representation for Method Handles
8.summary: Improve the implementation of method handles by replacing assembly language paths with an optimizable intermediate representation and then refactoring the implementation so that more work is done in portable Java code than is hardwired into the JVM.

8.title: Compact Profiles
8.summary: Define a few subset Profiles of the Java SE Platform Specification so that applications that do not require the entire Platform can be deployed and run on small devices.

8.title: Unicode BCP 47 Locale Matching
8.summary: Define APIs so that applications that use BCP 47 language tags (see RFC 5646) can match them to a user's language preferences in a way that conforms to RFC 4647.

8.title: NSA Suite B Cryptographic Algorithms
8.summary: Provide implementations of the cryptographic algorithms required by NSA Suite B.

8.title: Lambda Expressions & Virtual Extension Methods
8.summary: Add lambda expressions (closures) and supporting features, including method references, enhanced type inference, and virtual extension methods, to the Java programming language and platform.

8.title: Improve Locale Data Packaging and Adopt Unicode CLDR Data
8.summary: Create a tool to convert LDML (Locale Data Markup Language) files into a format usable directly by the runtime library, define a way to package the results into modules, and then use these to incorporate the de-facto standard locale data published by the Unicode Consortium's CLDR project into the JDK.

8.title: Enhance the Certificate Revocation-Checking API
8.summary: Improve the certificate revocation-checking API to support best-effort checking, end-entity certificate checking, and mechanism-specific options and parameters.

8.title: Remove the Permanent Generation
8.summary: Remove the permanent generation from the Hotspot JVM and thus the need to tune the size of the permanent generation.

8.title: Overhaul JKS-JCEKS-PKCS12 Keystores
8.summary: Facilitate migrating data from JKS and JCEKS keystores by adding equivalent support to the PKCS#12 keystore. Enhance the KeyStore API to support new features such as entry metadata and logical views spanning several keystores. Enable the strong crypto algorithms introduced in JEP-121 to be used to protect keystore entries.

8.title: Configurable Secure Random-Number Generation
8.summary: Enhance the API for secure random-number generation so that it can be configured to operate within specified quality and responsiveness constraints.

9.title: Use CLDR Locale Data by Default
9.summary: Use locale data from the Unicode Consortium's Common Locale Data Repository (CLDR) by default.

9.title: Prepare JavaFX UI Controls & CSS APIs for Modularization
9.summary: Define public APIs for the JavaFX UI controls and CSS functionality that is presently only available via internal APIs and will hence become inaccessible due to modularization.

9.title: Unified arm32/arm64 Port
9.summary: Integrate the unified port of HotSpot for arm32 and arm64, contributed by Oracle, into the JDK.

9.title: Store Interned Strings in CDS Archives
9.summary: Store interned strings in class-data sharing (CDS) archives.

9.title: Linux/s390x Port
9.summary: Port JDK 9 to Linux/s390x.

9.title: Multi-Resolution Images
9.summary: Define a multi-resolution image API so that images with resolution variants can easily be manipulated and displayed.

9.title: Ahead-of-Time Compilation
9.summary: Compile Java classes to native code prior to launching the virtual machine.

9.title: Implement Selected ECMAScript 6 Features in Nashorn
9.summary: Implement, in Nashorn, a selected set of the many new features introduced in the 6th edition of ECMA-262, also known as ECMAScript 6, or ES6 for short.

9.title: Filter Incoming Serialization Data
9.summary: Allow incoming streams of object-serialization data to be filtered in order to improve both security and robustness.

9.title: Deprecate the Concurrent Mark Sweep (CMS) Garbage Collector
9.summary: Deprecate the Concurrent Mark Sweep (CMS) garbage collector, with the intent to stop supporting it in a future major release.

9.title: Process Import Statements Correctly
9.summary: Fix javac to properly accept and reject programs regardless of the order of import statements and extends and implements clauses.

9.title: Annotations Pipeline 2.0
9.summary: Redesign the javac annotations pipeline to better address the requirements of annotations and tools that process annotations.

9.title: Remove GC Combinations Deprecated in JDK 8
9.summary: Remove the GC combinations that were previously deprecated in JDK 8 via JEP 173.

9.title: HarfBuzz Font-Layout Engine
9.summary: Replace the existing ICU OpenType font-layout engine with HarfBuzz.

9.title: Tiered Attribution for javac
9.summary: Implement a new method type-checking strategy in javac to speed up attribution of poly expression in argument position.

9.title: Stack-Walking API
9.summary: Define an efficient standard API for stack walking that allows easy filtering of, and lazy access to, the information in stack traces.

9.title: Resolve Lint and Doclint Warnings
9.summary: The JDK code base contains numerous lint and doclint errors as reported by javac. These warnings should be resolved, at least for the fundamental parts of the platform.

9.title: BeanInfo Annotations
9.summary: Replace @beaninfo Javadoc tags with proper annotations, and process those annotations at run time to generate BeanInfo classes dynamically.

9.title: Milling Project Coin
9.summary: The small language changes included in Project Coin / JSR 334 as part of JDK 7 / Java SE 7 have been easy to use and have worked well in practice. However, a few amendments could address the rough edges of those changes. In addition, using underscore ("_") as an identifier, which generates a warning as of Java SE 8, should be turned into an error in Java SE 9. It is also proposed that interfaces be allowed to have private methods.

9.title: Update JavaFX/Media to Newer Version of GStreamer
9.summary: Update the version of GStreamer included in FX/Media in order to improve security, stability, and performance.

9.title: Compact Strings
9.summary: Adopt a more space-efficient internal representation for strings.

9.title: Remove Demos and Samples
9.summary: Remove the outdated and unmaintained demos and samples.

9.title: Elide Deprecation Warnings on Import Statements
9.summary: As of Java SE 8, java compilers are required by reasonable interpretations of the Java Language Specification to issue deprecation warnings when a deprecated type is imported by name or when a deprecated member (method, field, nested type) is imported statically. These warnings are uninformative and should not be required. Deprecation warnings at actual uses of deprecated members should remain.

9.title: Merge Selected Xerces 2.11.0 Updates into JAXP
9.summary: Upgrade the version of the Xerces XML parser included in the JDK with important changes from Xerces 2.11.0.

9.title: Reorganize Documentation
9.summary: Update the organization of the documents in the JDK, in both the source repositories and the generated docs.

9.title: Datagram Transport Layer Security (DTLS)
9.summary: Define an API for Datagram Transport Layer Security (DTLS) version 1.0 (RFC 4347) and 1.2 (RFC 6347).

9.title: HiDPI Graphics on Windows and Linux
9.summary: Implement HiDPI graphics on Windows and Linux.

9.title: Improve Contended Locking
9.summary: Improve the performance of contended Java object monitors.

9.title: Modular Run-Time Images
9.summary: Restructure the JDK and JRE run-time images to accommodate modules and to improve performance, security, and maintainability. Define a new URI scheme for naming the modules, classes, and resources stored in a run-time image without revealing the internal structure or format of the image. Revise existing specifications as required to accommodate these changes.

9.title: Platform Logging API and Service
9.summary: Define a minimal logging API which platform classes can use to log messages, together with a service interface for consumers of those messages. A library or application can provide an implementation of this service in order to route platform log messages to the logging framework of its choice. If no implementation is provided then a default implementation based upon the java.util.logging API is used.

9.title: Module System
9.summary: Implement the Java Platform Module System, as specified by JSR 376, together with related JDK-specific changes and enhancements.

9.title: TIFF Image I/O
9.summary: Extend the standard set of Image I/O plugins to support the TIFF image format.

9.title: Encapsulate Most Internal APIs
9.summary: Encapsulate most of the JDK's internal APIs by default so that they are inaccessible at compile time, and prepare for a future release in which they will be inaccessible at run time. Ensure that critical, widely-used internal APIs are not encapsulated, so that they remain accessible until supported replacements exist for all or most of their functionality.

9.title: Unicode 7.0
9.summary: Upgrade existing platform APIs to support version 7.0 of the Unicode Standard.

9.title: Add More Diagnostic Commands
9.summary: Define additional diagnostic commands, in order to improve the diagnosability of Hotspot and the JDK.

9.title: Javadoc Search
9.summary: Add a search box to API documentation generated by the standard doclet that can be used to search for program elements and tagged words and phrases within the documentation. The search box appears in the header of all pages generated by the standard doclet.

9.title: Convenience Factory Methods for Collections
9.summary: Define library APIs to make it convenient to create instances of collections and maps with small numbers of elements, so as to ease the pain of not having collection literals in the Java programming language.

9.title: UTF-8 Property Resource Bundles
9.summary: Define a means for applications to specify property files encoded in UTF-8, and extend the ResourceBundle API to load them.

9.title: Process API Updates
9.summary: Improve the API for controlling and managing operating-system processes.

9.title: New Version-String Scheme
9.summary: Define a version-string scheme that easily distinguishes major, minor, and security-update releases, and apply it to the JDK.

9.title: Unicode 8.0
9.summary: Upgrade existing platform APIs to support version 8.0 of the Unicode Standard.

9.title: HTML5 Javadoc
9.summary: Enhance the javadoc tool to generate HTML5 markup.

9.title: XML Catalogs
9.summary: Develop a standard XML Catalog API that supports the OASIS XML Catalogs standard, v1.1. The API will define catalog and catalog-resolver abstractions which can be used with the JAXP processors that accept resolvers.

9.title: New Doclet API
9.summary: Provide a replacement for the Doclet API to leverage appropriate Java SE and JDK APIs, and update the standard doclet to use the new API.

9.title: Marlin Graphics Renderer
9.summary: Update Java 2D to use the Marlin Renderer as the default graphics rasterizer.

9.title: jshell: The Java Shell (Read-Eval-Print Loop)
9.summary: Provide an interactive tool to evaluate declarations, statements, and expressions of the Java programming language, together with an API so that other applications can leverage this functionality.

9.title: More Concurrency Updates
9.summary: An interoperable publish-subscribe framework, enhancements to the CompletableFuture API, and various other improvements.

9.title: Create PKCS12 Keystores by Default
9.summary: Transition the default keystore type from JKS to PKCS12.

9.title: Segmented Code Cache
9.summary: Divide the code cache into distinct segments, each of which contains compiled code of a particular type, in order to improve performance and enable future extensions.

9.title: Enhanced Method Handles
9.summary: Enhance the MethodHandle, MethodHandles, and MethodHandles.Lookup classes of the java.lang.invoke package to ease common use cases and enable better compiler optimizations by means of new MethodHandle combinators and lookup refinement.

9.title: HTTP/2 Client (Incubator)
9.summary: Define a new HTTP client API that implements HTTP/2 and WebSocket, and can replace the legacy HttpURLConnection API. The API will be delivered as an incubator module, as defined in JEP 11, with JDK 9. This implies:

9.title: Remove Launch-Time JRE Version Selection
9.summary: Remove the ability to request, at JRE launch time, a version of the JRE that is not the JRE being launched.

9.title: Modular Java Application Packaging
9.summary: Integrate features from Project Jigsaw into the Java Packager, including module awareness and custom run-time creation.

9.title: Platform-Specific Desktop Features
9.summary: Define a new public API to access platform-specific desktop features such as interacting with a task bar or dock, or listening for system or application events.

9.title: DRBG-Based SecureRandom Implementations
9.summary: Implement the three Deterministic Random Bit Generator (DRBG) mechanisms described in NIST 800-90Ar1.

9.title: Variable Handles
9.summary: Define a standard means to invoke the equivalents of various java.util.concurrent.atomic and sun.misc.Unsafe operations upon object fields and array elements, a standard set of fence operations for fine-grained control of memory ordering, and a standard reachability-fence operation to ensure that a referenced object remains strongly reachable.

9.title: Reserved Stack Areas for Critical Sections
9.summary: Reserve extra space on thread stacks for use by critical sections, so that they can complete even when stack overflows occur.

9.title: Unified GC Logging
9.summary: Reimplement GC logging using the unified JVM logging framework introduced in JEP 158.

9.title: Multi-Release JAR Files
9.summary: Extend the JAR file format to allow multiple, Java-release-specific versions of class files to coexist in a single archive.

9.title: Parser API for Nashorn
9.summary: Define a supported API for Nashorn's ECMAScript abstract syntax tree.

9.title: Linux/AArch64 Port
9.summary: Port JDK 9 to Linux/AArch64.

9.title: Additional Tests for Humongous Objects in G1
9.summary: Develop additional white-box tests for the Humongous Objects feature of the G1 Garbage Collector.

9.title: Unified JVM Logging
9.summary: Introduce a common logging system for all components of the JVM.

9.title: Test Class-File Attributes Generated by javac
9.summary: Write tests to verify the correctness of class-file attributes generated by javac.

9.title: Improve Test-Failure Troubleshooting
9.summary: Automatically collect diagnostic information which can be used for further troubleshooting in case of test failures and timeouts.

9.title: Smart Java Compilation, Phase Two
9.summary: Improve the sjavac tool so that it can be used by default in the JDK build, and generalize it so that it can be used to build large projects other than the JDK.

9.title: Improve Secure Application Performance
9.summary: Improve the performance of applications that are run with a security manager installed.

9.title: Dynamic Linking of Language-Defined Object Models
9.summary: Provide a facility for linking high-level operations on objects such as "read a property", "write a property", "invoke a callable object", etc., expressed as names in INVOKEDYNAMIC call sites. Provide a default linker for the usual semantics of these operations on plain Java objects, as well as a facility for installing language-specific linkers.

9.title: Generate Run-Time Compiler Tests Automatically
9.summary: Develop a tool to test the run-time compilers by automatically generating test cases.

9.title: Enhanced Deprecation
9.summary: Revamp the @Deprecated annotation, and provide tools to strengthen the API life cycle.

9.title: Remove the jhat Tool
9.summary: Remove the antiquated jhat tool.

9.title: Spin-Wait Hints
9.summary: Define an API to allow Java code to hint that a spin loop is being executed.

9.title: Compiler Control
9.summary: This JEP proposes an improved way to control the JVM compilers. It enables runtime manageable, method dependent compiler flags. (Immutable for the duration of a compilation.)

9.title: Enable GTK 3 on Linux
9.summary: Enable Java graphical applications, whether based on JavaFX, Swing, or AWT, to use either GTK 2 or GTK 3 on Linux.

9.title: Remove the JVM TI hprof Agent
9.summary: Remove the hprof agent from the JDK.

9.title: New HotSpot Build System
9.summary: Rewrite the HotSpot build system using the build-infra framework.

9.title: HotSpot C++ Unit-Test Framework
9.summary: Enable and encourage the development of C++ unit tests for HotSpot.

9.title: jlink: The Java Linker
9.summary: Create a tool that can assemble and optimize a set of modules and their dependencies into a custom run-time image as defined in JEP 220.

9.title: Indify String Concatenation
9.summary: Change the static String-concatenation bytecode sequence generated by javac to use invokedynamic calls to JDK library functions. This will enable future optimizations of String concatenation without requiring further changes to the bytecode emitted by javac.

9.title: OCSP Stapling for TLS
9.summary: Implement OCSP stapling via the TLS Certificate Status Request extension (section 8 of RFC 6066) and the Multiple Certificate Status Request Extension (RFC 6961).

9.title: Compile for Older Platform Versions
9.summary: Enhance javac so that it can compile Java programs to run on selected older versions of the platform.

9.title: Make G1 the Default Garbage Collector
9.summary: Make G1 the default garbage collector on 32- and 64-bit server configurations.

9.title: Modular Source Code
9.summary: Reorganize the JDK source code into modules, enhance the build system to compile modules, and enforce module boundaries at build time.

9.title: Validate JVM Command-Line Flag Arguments
9.summary: Validate the arguments to all JVM command-line flags so as to avoid crashes, and ensure that appropriate error messages are displayed when they are invalid.

9.title: Deprecate the Applet API
9.summary: Deprecate the Applet API, which is rapidly becoming irrelevant as web-browser vendors remove support for Java browser plug-ins. Guide developers to alternative technologies such as Java Web Start or installable applications.

9.title: Leverage CPU Instructions for GHASH and RSA
9.summary: Improve the performance of GHASH and RSA cryptographic operations by leveraging recently-introduced SPARC and Intel x64 CPU instructions.

9.title: Java-Level JVM Compiler Interface
9.summary: Develop a Java based JVM compiler interface (JVMCI) enabling a compiler written in Java to be used by the JVM as a dynamic compiler.

9.title: SHA-3 Hash Algorithms
9.summary: Implement the SHA-3 cryptographic hash functions (BYTE-only) specified in NIST FIPS 202.

9.title: The Modular JDK
9.summary: Use the Java Platform Module System, specified by JSR 376 and implemented by JEP 261, to modularize the JDK.

9.title: TLS Application-Layer Protocol Negotiation Extension
9.summary: Extend the javax.net.ssl package to support the TLS Application Layer Protocol Negotiation (ALPN) Extension, which provides the means to negotiate an application protocol for a TLS connection.

9.title: Disable SHA-1 Certificates
9.summary: Improve the security configuration of the JDK by providing a more flexible mechanism to disable X.509 certificate chains with SHA-1 based signatures.

10.title: Consolidate the JDK Forest into a Single Repository
10.summary: Combine the numerous repositories of the JDK forest into a single repository in order to simplify and streamline development.

10.title: Local-Variable Type Inference
10.summary: Enhance the Java Language to extend type inference to declarations of local variables with initializers.

10.title: Root Certificates
10.summary: Provide a default set of root Certification Authority (CA) certificates in the JDK.

10.title: Experimental Java-Based JIT Compiler
10.summary: Enable the Java-based JIT compiler, Graal, to be used as an experimental JIT compiler on the Linux/x64 platform.

10.title: Parallel Full GC for G1
10.summary: Improve G1 worst-case latencies by making the full GC parallel.

10.title: Garbage Collector Interface
10.summary: Improve the source code isolation of different garbage collectors by introducing a clean garbage collector (GC) interface.

10.title: Heap Allocation on Alternative Memory Devices
10.summary: Enable the HotSpot VM to allocate the Java object heap on an alternative memory device, such as an NV-DIMM, specified by the user.

10.title: Remove the Native-Header Generation Tool (javah)
10.summary: Remove the javah tool from the JDK.

10.title: Additional Unicode Language-Tag Extensions
10.summary: Enhance java.util.Locale and related APIs to implement additional Unicode extensions of BCP 47 language tags.

10.title: Time-Based Release Versioning
10.summary: Revise the version-string scheme of the Java SE Platform and the JDK, and related versioning information, for present and future time-based release models.

10.title: Thread-Local Handshakes
10.summary: Introduce a way to execute a callback on threads without performing a global VM safepoint. Make it both possible and cheap to stop individual threads and not just all threads or none.

10.title: Application Class-Data Sharing
10.summary: To improve startup and footprint, extend the existing Class-Data Sharing ("CDS") feature to allow application classes to be placed in the shared archive.
